page.title: 04The Donington Collection
page.content: The Donington Collection of Single Seater Racing Cars, a museum belonging to the owner of Donington Park Racing Circuit, was opened in 1973. It houses the world's largest collection of single seater racing cars as well as a collection of racing motorcycles. The display of over 100 Grand Prix racing cars of all ages, varying from Austin 7 Racers to the recent Championship Winners McLaren, portrays the history and development of both the sport and the cars. On the wall of the museum foyer are the autographs of famous motor racing drivers. The museum is open 7 days a week and employs two full time staff. Within the museum complex are a motor racing accessories shop and a cafeteria.
